intro: Arundinaria hosidaikitiana f. spanolongitricha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bamboo, is a rare and relict species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, culm-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique morphology, including the presence of long, stiff hairs on the leaf sheaths and stems. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and conservation status, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
